Isoprenaline

Isoprenaline stimulates beta-1 and beta-2 receptors. In clinical practice, isoprenaline is used for its positive chronotropic effect in the treatment of bradyarrhythmias (e.g. sinus bradycardia, as well as AV-block and sino-atrial block).

Isoprenaline is associated with:

  • Positive inotropic (through beta-1 stimulation) effects
  • Positive chronotropic (also via beta-1 stimulation) effects
  • Bronchodilation (via beta-2 stimulation)
  • Peripheral vasodilation (also via beta-2 stimulation)

Side effects include:

  • Hypotension (due to peripheral vasodilation)
  • Palpitations (due to beta-1 stimulation)
  • Arrhythmias (due to beta-1 stimulation)
